:DHFCQA.TenantRelations@alfuttaim.com> >; Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

 

Dear Hazelle,

 

Thank you for your follow-up emails regarding the damaged MUPI screen incident at Doha Festival City.

 

We have taken the following steps to address this matter:

 

1.	Reported the incident to our insurance company
2.	A claim has been registered under reference number 75/PL/71
3.	Our insurance broker is now handling the case

 

As instructed by our insurer, and without prejudice to any admission of liability, we kindly request the following information from you:

 

*	The specific compensation amount you are seeking for the damages
*	Detailed quotations supporting your compensation request

 

This information will be crucial for our insurance broker to process and evaluate the claim efficiently.

 

Once we receive these details from you, we will promptly forward them to our insurance broker for review and further action.

 

If you need any clarification or have additional questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work towards resolving this issue.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

Subject: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

Dear Nada and Team,

 

We would like to share with you as reference the incident report regarding one of the screens in the mall which was accidentally damaged by one of your staff from Purificacion Garcia.

 

The incident has been forwarded to Elan Media, the owner of the screens.

We are waiting for their assessment and they might request for the tenant’s insurance copies as a support for their own damage claims.

 

We will update you in case we have an information from them.

 

Thank you.

 

 

Best regards,

 

 



 

Tenant Relations Team

:DHFCQA.TenantRelations@alfuttaim.com> >; Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

 

Dear Hazelle,

 

Thank you for your follow-up emails regarding the damaged MUPI screen incident at Doha Festival City.

 

We have taken the following steps to address this matter:

 

1.	Reported the incident to our insurance company
2.	A claim has been registered under reference number 75/PL/71
3.	Our insurance broker is now handling the case

 

As instructed by our insurer, and without prejudice to any admission of liability, we kindly request the following information from you:

 

*	The specific compensation amount you are seeking for the damages
*	Detailed quotations supporting your compensation request

 

This information will be crucial for our insurance broker to process and evaluate the claim efficiently.

 

Once we receive these details from you, we will promptly forward them to our insurance broker for review and further action.

 

If you need any clarification or have additional questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work towards resolving this issue.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

Subject: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

Dear Nada and Team,

 

We would like to share with you as reference the incident report regarding one of the screens in the mall which was accidentally damaged by one of your staff from Purificacion Garcia.

 

The incident has been forwarded to Elan Media, the owner of the screens.

We are waiting for their assessment and they might request for the tenant’s insurance copies as a support for their own damage claims.

 

We will update you in case we have an information from them.

 

Thank you.

 

 

Best regards,

Subject: RE: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

 

Dear Hazelle,

 

Thank you for your follow-up emails regarding the damaged MUPI screen incident at Doha Festival City.

 

We have taken the following steps to address this matter:

 

1.	Reported the incident to our insurance company
2.	A claim has been registered under reference number 75/PL/71
3.	Our insurance broker is now handling the case

 

As instructed by our insurer, and without prejudice to any admission of liability, we kindly request the following information from you:

 

*	The specific compensation amount you are seeking for the damages
*	Detailed quotations supporting your compensation request

 

This information will be crucial for our insurance broker to process and evaluate the claim efficiently.

 

Once we receive these details from you, we will promptly forward them to our insurance broker for review and further action.

 

If you need any clarification or have additional questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work towards resolving this issue.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

Subject: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

Dear Nada and Team,

 

We would like to share with you as reference the incident report regarding one of the screens in the mall which was accidentally damaged by one of your staff from Purificacion Garcia.

 

The incident has been forwarded to Elan Media, the owner of the screens.

We are waiting for their assessment and they might request for the tenant’s insurance copies as a support for their own damage claims.

 

We will update you in case we have an information from them.

 

Thank you.

 

 

Best regards,

 

 



 

Tenant Relations Team

:DHFCQA.TenantRelations@alfuttaim.com> >; Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

 

Dear Hazelle,

 

Thank you for your follow-up emails regarding the damaged MUPI screen incident at Doha Festival City.

 

We have taken the following steps to address this matter:

 

1.	Reported the incident to our insurance company
2.	A claim has been registered under reference number 75/PL/71
3.	Our insurance broker is now handling the case

 

As instructed by our insurer, and without prejudice to any admission of liability, we kindly request the following information from you:

 

*	The specific compensation amount you are seeking for the damages
*	Detailed quotations supporting your compensation request

 

This information will be crucial for our insurance broker to process and evaluate the claim efficiently.

 

Once we receive these details from you, we will promptly forward them to our insurance broker for review and further action.

 

If you need any clarification or have additional questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work towards resolving this issue.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Tenant Report - Damaged MUPI screen in the mall - Purificacion Garcia

 

Dear Nada and Team,

 

We would like to share with you as reference the incident report regarding one of the screens in the mall which was accidentally damaged by one of your staff from Purificacion Garcia.

 

The incident has been forwarded to Elan Media, the owner of the screens.

We are waiting for their assessment and they might request for the tenant’s insurance copies as a support for their own damage claims.

 

We will update you in case we have an information from them.

 

Thank you.

 

 

Best regards,

 

 



 

Tenant Relations Team
